skill.name: lint-dotnet
skill.description: Run .NET architecture linter to check for MSBuild/CPM violations
skill.summary: Run .NET architecture linter to check for MSBuild/CPM violations
skill.author: ANcpLua

security_audit.summary: All 24 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The analyzer misidentified markdown documentation examples as executable code and cryptographic metadata hashes as weak algorithms. This is a documentation-only skill that references an external bash script for linting .NET architecture patterns. No actual execution, network calls, or file access occurs within the skill files.

content.value_statement: .NET projects often have inconsistent build patterns that cause maintenance problems. This skill runs an automated linter to check for MSBuild violations and Central Package Management issues before they cause problems in your codebase.
actual_capabilities: Check for hardcoded versions in Directory.Packages.props
Ensure Version.props is a symlink not copied
limitations: Only checks MSBuild and XML patterns in .props and .csproj files
Requires .NET project structure with standard layout
Does not validate package versions against NuGet feeds

use_cases.title: Validate project structure
use_cases.description: Check that your .NET project follows established architecture patterns before committing code changes

use_cases.title: Enforce build standards
use_cases.description: Run as part of CI pipelines to ensure all projects maintain consistent build patterns across teams

use_cases.title: Review architecture compliance
use_cases.description: Audit repositories for consistent use of Central Package Management and proper version handling conventions

prompt_templates.title: Lint with output
prompt_templates.prompt: /lint-dotnet to check for any MSBuild violations in this project

prompt_templates.title: Fix guidance
prompt_templates.prompt: /lint-dotnet and explain how to fix the violations that are reported

prompt_templates.title: Full validation
prompt_templates.prompt: /lint-dotnet to validate that all .NET architecture rules are satisfied before I commit

output: No violations found. Safe to proceed.
Version.props imported only in allowed files
Fix: Replace with $(PackageNameVersion) and define in Version.props
MyApp.csproj line 12: Inline Version attribute on PackageReference
Fix: Remove Version attr and add to Directory.Packages.props

best_practices: Run /lint-dotnet before committing .NET projects to catch architecture violations early in development
Use Central Package Management for all version references to ensure consistency across solutions
Keep Version.props as a symlink in consumer repositories, never copy the file directly
anti_patterns: Hardcoding versions like Version="1.2.3" directly in Directory.Packages.props instead of using variables
Importing Version.props from arbitrary .props files outside the allowed list
Copying Version.props instead of symlinking it in downstream repositories

faq.question: What versions of .NET does this support?
faq.answer: This linter checks MSBuild patterns compatible with .NET Core 3.1 and all newer .NET versions including .NET 5 and beyond.

faq.question: Does this linter modify files?
faq.answer: No. The linter only reads project files and reports violations. It does not automatically fix any issues.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into my CI pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. The underlying script runs from bash and requires only the .NET SDK installed on your CI agents.

faq.question: Does this send any data externally?
faq.answer: No. The linter runs entirely locally and only reads project files on your machine without network access.

faq.question: What rules are currently implemented?
faq.answer: RULE_A checks hardcoded versions, RULE_B checks import locations, RULE_C checks symlinks, RULE_G checks inline version attributes.

faq.question: How is this different from dotnet format?
faq.answer: dotnet format styles code for formatting. This linter enforces architectural patterns like Central Package Management and version handling conventions.
